spookyFacts: In 1816, Mary Shelley conceived Frankenstein during a dark and stormy night at Lake Geneva, after a nightmare about a scientist reanimating a corpse.
The first computer bug was an actual moth found trapped in a Harvard Mark II computer in 1947, preserved in the lab's logbook with the note 'First actual case of bug being found.'
Ancient Egyptian embalmers would remove the brain through the nose using a hook, believing it was useless - they thought the heart was the center of intelligence.
The dancing plague of 1518 saw hundreds of people dance uncontrollably for days in Strasbourg, with some dancing until they collapsed from exhaustion or death.
Deep in the ocean, there exists a 'whale fall' ecosystem where an entire community of creatures feeds on a single dead whale for decades, creating a haunting underwater graveyard.
